title: Will Self - Novels, Stories & Non-fiction (16 books)
description:
WILL SELF (b. 1961) is an English author, journalist and television personality.  His work has been translated into 22 languages, and his novel UMBRELLA was shortlisted for the Man Booker Prize.  His fiction is known for being satirical, grotesque, and fantastical, and is predominantly set within London.  His subject matter often includes mental illness, illegal drugs and psychiatry.


The following books are in ePUB format:

* THE BOOK OF DAVE (Bloomsbury, 2006)

* THE BUTT: An Exit Strategy (Bloomsbury, 2008)

* COCK AND BULL (Bloomsbury, 1992)

* DORIAN: An Imitation (Penguin, 2003)

* GREAT APES (Bloomsbury, 1997)

* GREY AREA & OTHER STORIES (Atlantic Monthly, 1994)

* HOW THE DEAD LIVE (Grove, 2000)

* MY IDEA OF FUN (Grove, 1993)

* PSYCHO TOO (Bloomsbury, 2009).  With Ralph Steadman.

* PSYCHOGEOGRAPHY (Bloomsbury, 2007).  With Ralph Steadman.

* THE QUANTITY THEORY OF INSANITY (Bloomsbury, 1991)

* SHARK (Grove, 2014)

* THE SWEET SMELL OF PSYCHOSIS (Grove, 1996)

* TOUGH, TOUGH TOYS FOR TOUGH, TOUGH BOYS (Grove, 1998)

* UMBRELLA (Bloomsbury, 2012)

* THE UNDIVIDED SELF: Selected Stories (Bloomsbury, 2008)

* WALKING TO HOLLYWOOD: Memories of Before the Fall (Grove, 2010)
